intro: Tittmannia sulcata, commonly known as the smoothleaf tittmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Tittmannia sulcata plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
